it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common

Class AdrenalineProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.AdrenalineProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>

    public class AdrenalineProperties
extends Properties
    Provides methods to load and retrieve runtime parameters used both by the client and the server.

    The parameters are represented by properties

    This class uses the singleton pattern

    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini, Lorenzo Farinelli
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static void loadLoggerConfig(String fallbackConfig)
      Loads the logging configuration: From the file specified in property adrenaline.loggerconfig If the property is not specified, it uses the resource provided as fallbackConfig
      void loadProperties()
      Performs initial loading of server properties It first checks whether the user provided a config file to be used, otherwise checking for its existence in the application folder.

    • Method Detail

      • getProperties

        public static AdrenalineProperties getProperties()
        Returns the instance of the class
        Returns:
        The object representing the instance

      • loadProperties

        public void loadProperties()
        Performs initial loading of server properties It first checks whether the user provided a config file to be used, otherwise checking for its existence in the application folder. After that it checks whether the user passed any of the default arguments defined in ARGUMENTS, overwriting properties accordingly.

      • loadLoggerConfig

        public static void loadLoggerConfig(String fallbackConfig)
        Loads the logging configuration:
        1. From the file specified in property adrenaline.loggerconfig
        2. If the property is not specified, it uses the resource provided as fallbackConfig
        Parameters:
        fallbackConfig - the path of the resource on which to fallback
